questions.question: If the intensity of the rainfall is more than the infiltration capacity of the soil, then the infiltration rate will be

answers.a: Equal to the rate of rainfall
answers.c: More than the rate of rainfall

explanations.a: If the intensity of the rainfall is more than the infiltration capacity of the soil, then the infiltration rate will be not be equal to the rate of rainfall.
explanations.b: If the intensity of the rainfall is more than the infiltration capacity of the soil, then the infiltration rate will be equal to infiltration capacity. Because the infiltration capacity is the maximum rate at which water enters soil.
explanations.c: If the intensity of the rainfall is more than the infiltration capacity of the soil, then the infiltration rate will be not more than the rate of rainfall.
explanations.d: If the intensity of the rainfall is more than the infiltration capacity of the soil, then the infiltration rate will be not more than infiltration capacity . Because the infiltration capacity is the maximum rate at which water enters soil.
